title: Newtons third law - two objects being pushed

content.question: Two blocks, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, are pushed at constant speed across a rough horizontal surface by a horizontal force <math alttext="F sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>H</mtext></msub></math>, as shown. The force exerted on Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> by Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and the force exerted on Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> by Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is <math alttext="F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following best describes what happens when the magnitude of <math alttext="F sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>H</mtext></msub></math> is increased?

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> would decrease and <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> would increase.

<math alttext="the absolute value of F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> would increase and <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> would decrease.

<math alttext="the absolute value of F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> is greater than <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, but both increase as <math alttext="F sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>H</mtext></msub></math> increases.

<math alttext="the absolute value of F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> and <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> would both increase and would remain equal to each other.

content.answer: <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> and <math alttext="the absolute value of F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></math> would both increase and would remain equal to each other.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
